job.title: Data Scientist
job.description: <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Work with a small team of data scientists, software engineers and domain experts to build the next generation of Novi’s platform</li><li>Develop novel solutions to open-ended, challenging and long-standing industry problems</li><li>Engage in thought leadership within the company and community</li><li>Mentor other team members on domain knowledge and technical solutions</li><li>Develop software to deliver solutions to ill-posed problems using sparse, noisy spatiotemporal data</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Required Skills &amp;</strong> E<strong>xperience</strong></p><ul><li>Minimum 5 years of hands-on data science and machine learning experience</li><li>Foundation in integrating data-driven methods with physics-based models</li><li>Strong foundation in statistics and machine Learning</li><li>Strong software engineering principles and software development lifecycle experience (e.g., git, unit tests, CI)</li><li>Strong familiarity with Python and PyData stack (e.g., pandas, numpy, scipy)</li><li>Strong familiarity with ML Frameworks (e.g., scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow)</li><li>Experience going from algorithm development to production code</li><li>Experience modeling time series and spatial datasets</li><li>Experience deploying callable ML models in a production environment (e.g., REST API, TensorFlow Serving)</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Preferred Skills &amp;</strong> E<strong>xperience</strong></p><ul><li>Open-source plotting libraries (e.g., altair, matplotlib, holoviz)</li><li>Database query &amp; ETL (SQL &amp; NoSQL)</li><li>AWS tools (e.g., lambda, EC2, etc.)</li><li>Probabilistic programming (e.g., Stan, PyMC, Pyro)</li><li>Model interpretation and explainability tools (e.g., Shapley)</li><li>Linux systems and command-line interfaces (e.g., bash)</li><li>Container and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, Nomad)</li><li>Previous work on an agile team</li><li>Experience in oil and gas</li></ul><p></p>
